page.title: 09RELIGION MILLBROOK CHURCH
page.content: Millbrook Church is a quite big church and it overlooks the village aS it is on a big hill.On a very clear day you can see the Wash.There are two main routes up to the church,either a steep hill or a dirt track.The church did have a clock on the wall but they dismantled it because it went wrong. Sir & Lady Richardson were buried there.They were the people who owned Avenue House in Church Street Ampthill which is now a Historical place.Lord & Lady Holland of Park House Ampthill had a daughter about 120 years ago, Georgina Fox ,who died at the age of eleven.Doctor Alan,librarian of the house,liked her so much he left a trust fund of ten shillings (50p) to eleven girls under the age of eleven and that live in Millbrook.The whole family plus Dr Alan are buried in the churchyard.
